questiontext.text:
Which of the following numbers are irrational? Exactly three of the numbers are irrational. Selecting more or fewer will result in an incorrect answer.

[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

An irrational number is a number that cannot be written in the form \(\displaystyle \frac{p}{q} \), where \( p \) and \( q \) are integers and \( q \neq 0 \).

To decide whether a number is rational or irrational, use the following rules:

  • Square roots: If the number inside the square root is a perfect square, the result is rational. If it is not a perfect square, the result is irrational.
  • Special numbers: The numbers \( \pi \) and \( e \) are irrational.
  • Decimals:
    • Decimals that terminate or repeat are rational.
    • Decimals that do not terminate and do not repeat are irrational.

Applying these rules to the given list, the irrational numbers are:

\[\displaystyle {@correct_answers[1][3]@},\; {@correct_answers[2][3]@},\; {@correct_answers[3][3]@} \]

If you selected any other numbers, check which rule above applies to them and revise your choice.
